meanings.definition: To free from embarrassment or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: She helped me disembarrass myself from the awkward situation.
meanings.sent2: I needed to disembarrass myself from the embarrassing mistake I made.
meanings.sent3: Trying to dance with two left feet, he needed to disembarrass himself from the situation.
meanings.sent4: The magician's tricks disembarrassed the audience from their skepticism.
meanings.sent5: The kind words of encouragement disembarrassed her from her self-doubt.

meanings.definition: To rid of obstacles or hindrances.
meanings.sent1: He worked hard to disembarrass the path of fallen branches.
meanings.sent2: The team needed to disembarrass the project of unnecessary complications.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to disembarrass the bird feeder of the pesky raccoon.
meanings.sent4: The new technology disembarrassed the process of manual errors.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk disembarrassed the team of their doubts and fears.
